input: President Biden has laid out plans for a $2 trillion infrastructure rebuild over the next four years. Biden intends the plan to be paid for in part by raising taxes on businesses and the wealthy. The plan includes rebuilding roads and bridges, expanding access to clean drinking water, strengthening infrastructure for broadband internet and electric vehicles, and investing in public transit, among other initiatives.
output: President Biden has proposed a four-year, $2 trillion infrastructure rebuild plan to be paid for by raising taxes on businesses and the wealthy. The plan would focus on rebuilding roads, bridges, and public transit, as well as providing access to clean drinking water and expanding infrastructure for broadband internet and electric vehicles. It is hoped that this plan will help create jobs and strengthen communities across the US.
